title: Calico Corn
ingredients: 1 large heavy sweet red pepper, stemmed, cored, seeded, and finely diced
2 large garlic cloves, peeled and minced
1 fresh jalapeño chile, stemmed, seeded, and minced
3 cups corn kernels; defrosted if frozen or canned well drained
1 (20-ounce) can of white or yellow hominy, well drained (about 2 cups total)
4 green onions, trimmed and sliced (about ⅔ cup total)

Set a large skillet over medium heat and in it melt the butter.  When the butter is melted stir in the sweet red pepper, the garlic, and the jalapeño and sauté, stirring once or twice, for about 5 minutes.  Stir in the corn, the hominy, green onions, and the salt and stir to mix.  Cook the mixture, covered, stirring once or twice, until all of the ingredients are well heated, about 4 minutes.
Taste and adjust for saltiness, if necessary.  Transfer the mixture to a serving bowl and bring it to the table; or, serve immediately.
source: The El Paso Chile Company’s Texas Border Cookbook, by W. Park Kerr and Norma Kerr, published by William Morrow and Co., Inc., New York, © 1992 by W. Park Kerr and Norma Kerr and Michael McLaughlin.
